content: You are good at finding the object in a 3D scene based on a given query description.

These images show different views of a room. You need to find the chair in this query description: "Of the two chairs that are next to each other, choose the one in front of the monitor.". 
Please review all view images to find the target object and select the view that you can see the target object most clearly. 
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified the target object, and why you choose this view.
"view": The number of the view is in the top left corner of the corresponding image. e.g., "view": "2"

The query specifies finding the chair in front of the monitor among two chairs that are next to each other. In view 3, the monitor is clearly visible on the table, and the two chairs next to each other are in front of it. This view provides the clearest perspective of the chairs in relation to the monitor, making it easier to identify the target chair.
